data.title: EastEnders exclusive! Natalie Cassidy tells Inside Soap: "Another 30 years as Sonia? Why not!"
data.meta_description: “It’s crazy, isn’t it? Makes you feel old!” laughs EastEnders icon Natalie Cassidy, as Inside Soap congratulates her on 30 years of playing Sonia. “I’m around younger members of the cast at work and I say to them, ‘How old are you?’ and when they say 11, I tell them, ‘I was doing this at […] More
data.text:
“It’s crazy, isn’t it? Makes you feel old!” laughs EastEnders icon Natalie Cassidy, as Inside Soap congratulates her on 30 years of playing Sonia. “I’m around younger members of the cast at work and I say to them, ‘How old are you?’ and when they say 11, I tell them, ‘I was doing this at your age!’. And that’s when I realise how long it’s been; it’s amazing looking back.”

Natalie joined the Square with the Jackson family in 1993, one year after Inside Soap first hit the shelves, so we feel as though we’ve lived her journey with her. Talking to Nat is such a pleasure, as she’s very much an old soul who’s learned from legends such as June Brown (Dot Cotton), Wendy Richard (Pauline Fowler) and Barbara Windsor (Peggy Mitchell). And while Sonia has inherited both the spirit and wisdom of their characters, Natalie lives and breathes all of the values that you’d expect from an EastEnders stalwart honouring their legacies.

Here’s a sneaky preview of our exclusive big interview, on sale Tuesday 13th February…

Congratulations on such a milestone, Natalie! Does your Walford debut feel like yesterday?

Thank you so much! It actually doesn’t feel like yesterday to me, and I don’t know whether that’s because I was so young, but those days do feel a long time ago now. People message me to talk about Classic EastEnders [on the Drama channel] and say, “Remember when you were doing this with Nigel, Clare and Janine?”, and I go, “Oh God, yeah, I do remember now!” We were a little crew back then.

How did you get the job? And did it change your life?

Being 10, you don’t realise what you’re getting into. I was just a little girl going up the road to Anna Scher, my acting teacher, who sadly passed away not long ago. There was this little school in Islington and we’d get EastEnders casting people come to sit in on our improv work. I think they just thought, ‘She’s a bit fun’ and so I got the audition, went up for the part and got it!

Were you from an acting family?

None of my family are actors or in the entertainment industry, although a few of them should be, as I think there are a few funny bones and a few characters! Getting this job was about luck, being in the right place at the right time, and then to keep it for as long as I have is down to professionalism, being good at what you do and being kind. I believe I stand for all the right things and what it takes to be in a show for this long.

When did you meet the other Jacksons for the first time?

We met for a mini photo shoot for some family piccies! Again, I was very young, and it was just really interesting thinking that Lindsey [Coulson, who played Carol Jackson] was going to be my mum, and Howard [Antony, aka Alan] my dad. I always loved the breakfast scenes in the Jackson house; being little, the trumpet days and when it was all about having your toast in the purple kitchen!

Read the full version of this interview in the latest Inside Soap – it’s on sale Tuesday 13th Feb!

How to get your weekly copy of Inside Soap

LOCAL SHOPS: As always, the major supermarkets and grocery stores should have the new issue on their shelves – but if you wish to stay closer to home, we’ve been working hard to make sure that local convenience stores have stock as well.ONLINE SHOP: The major supermarkets can deliver Inside Soap along with your online shopping. Just add it to your basket as you would anything else.

HOME DELIVERY FROM YOUR NEWSAGENT: Many local newsagents run a home-delivery service, and will be happy to deliver a copy to your door every week. Just pop in or ring them to place your order

SUBSCRIBE BY POST: We have fantastic money-saving deals on subscriptions – including free delivery! Get your magazine delivered by post every week, save money and never miss an issue. Click here to find out more, or call 01858 438 863

CLICK TO BUY: See www.magsdirect.co.uk/insidesoap to have this week’s issue of your favourite magazine sent to your home! Order online by Monday at midday and we’ll post-out the new issue, first class. You can pre-order future issues too. No contracts, no big commitments!

Postage and packaging costs apply.

SUBSCRIBE ON YOUR PHONE OR TABLET: Have the latest issue sent to your device every Tuesday, and at a great discount. Just log on to www.hearstmagazines.co.uk/inside-soap-magazine-subscription. Select “Digital”, choose your deal, order, and your confirmation email will click you through to the world of Inside Soap, right in the palm of your your hand!

BUY A SINGLE ISSUE ON PHONE OR TABLET: You can purchase single issues on our app for iPhone or iPad, Google Play and Kindle, or via Zinio.
